content.description: Claw past the low roof to a small horizontal ledge. Reachy, powerful moves take you to the next bolt. Balance and technique carry you the rest of the way, as you continue up and then eventually left a bit across the golden face.
content.location: Dog Boy Village, to the right of Everybody Knows Fire. Starts just left of a finger crack running through the low roof (Gold Finger).

content.description: This route really keeps you guessing with a variety of interesting moves as you climb past 6 bolts to the anchors.
content.location: In Dog Boy's Village. After rappelling in on Sloppy When Wet, walk down and left around the buttress. You will eventually come to a nice, flat section of wall. This route is on that section of wall, and starts about 15 feet right of a tree.

content.description:
Another Foster Falls gem with a mix of climbs for everyone: ranging from 5.9 - 12c there is something here for everyone in your party. Just past the Paradox Wall, it is a great alternative if you're looking to change it up a bit. One of the few areas in Foster Falls with baby multi-pitch lines. 60M rope at minimum, and at least 6-12 draws required for most climbs.  

  Routes right to left: 

  Secret Passage 12a   Half Man 10c   Half Beast 11a (starts on ledge above Half Man - same bolt line) 

(Half Man and Half Beast make a small multi-pitch climb)

  Golden Girl 10c   Prison of the Mind 12c (starts on ledge above and to the right of Golden Girl) *(GG and PoM make a small multi-pitch climb) 

  Everybody Knows Fire 9   Finding the Trust 10d   The Process 12a   Wolf Boy 11+ 

  Chestnutt's Route 12a   Dead Battery 12a   Unknown 12a
